title: (x) Lora Lee - (similar to) Ballantines {Mike Yanega}
content: hey im trying to find wat this is called? iv found something similar called 'larissa' i believe but not sure - and i can not find a mac download 4 it... im not sure if the font shown is custom or not - but if it is i would be very grateful if u can provide any fonts/font names which fit into this 1950's style. free download links very welcome. im no expert so any help would be appreciated! Thanks\
author: regan

comments.content: 'Larissa' is one of many names for a font whose correct name (I think) is ['Ballantines'](http://web.archive.org/web/20101222041829/http:/www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=Ballantines). Other names are [Biorst](http://web.archive.org/web/20101222041829/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/biorst.htm), Dianna, Cotillion, Balladeer, Progena & Premi. I have linked to two of them, as Biorst is only $2. You might use Fontseek to look for some of the other names if you are willing to take your chances that you will find an uncorrupted copy on a 'freeware' site. Considering that what you are looking for comes from a non-digital piece of sculpted type, I think this is a fair approximation for the style you want to match.

thats great!   
thanks mike
